page.title: 12ARABLE FARMING
page.content: Arable farming is far more important than livestock in this area primarily because of the favourable climatic conditions for cereal crops such as wheat and barley. Other factors of importance are the gently undulating landscape which allows large machinery to be used and the heavy clay soils which retain the low rainfall in an area of permeable rock. Of the cereals barley is the most important, large quantities are now used for animal feed in addition to the traditional use for malting. Other crops include potatoes, field beans and increasingly rape seed. These are used in rotation with the cereals and like them are usually cash crops. Potatoes are grown for local consumption but some are marketed as far away as Sweden. The good road network helps long distance transport.
